Biblical Hebrew for linguists

Westminster Leningrad Codex

ʾăviyyāhū אֲבִיָּ֫הוּ ‘Abijah’ (Hebrew)

Etymology: from H1 and H3050 | Roots: אב יה | Morphology: N:N-M-P

ʾăviyyāhū
1 Abia or Abiah or Abijah = "Jehovah is (my) father"
1) king of Judah, son and successor of Rehoboam
2) second son of Samuel
3) son of Jeroboam the first, king of Israel
4) son of Becher, a Benjamite
5) head of a priestly house (one of the 24 Levite groups)
6) head of a priestly house (after the exile)
7) wife of Hezron
8) mother of Hezekiah (cf H021)

« Back Forth »

Mentioned in 1 Samuel 8:2 1 Kings 14:1 Nehemiah 10:8, 12:4, 12:17 1 Chronicles 2:24, 3:10, 6:13, 7:8, 24:10 2 Chronicles 11:20, 11:22, 12:16, 13:1, 13:2, 13:3, 13:4, 13:15, 13:17, 13:19, 13:20, 13:21, 13:22, 13:23, 29:1
